content:

author: chfast
content: How to interpret `excess_data_gas`? Is this just a param to compute data gas price?

author: chfast
content: Because it is not `data_gas_used - target`, isn't it?

author: chfast
content: <@393119312350543872> are you working on more state tests for 4844?

author: __flcl
content: It's ~~indeed ~~ `max(excess_data_gas + data_gas_used - target, 0)`. But calculated using parent block's `data_gas_used`  and `excess_data_gas `

author: dimitry8570
content: Yes, some merged already. Nimbus client implemented 4844

author: dimitry8570
content: For data gas used and excess data gas need more tests though. I just did basics blobtx checks

author: chfast
content: I used tests from ethereum/tests by <@393119312350543872> (ğŸ™ ) to implement `BLOBHASH` and blob transactions validation. But some things seem horrible wrong in the implementation so tests cases are still missing. https://github.com/ethereum/evmone/pull/668

author: dimitry8570
content: This tests are based on nimbus if you find implementation issue difference to the specs, lets investigate

author: jochembrouwer
content: `excess_data_gas` aggregates over blocks. The `data_gas_used` is a param which stores how much data gas is used (this scales with the amount of blobs per block)

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Currently the target blobs are 3 and the max blobs per block are 6.
If a block has more blobs than the target blobs, the excessDataGas will increase. If it has less blobs than target blobs, it will decrease. (I think the data gas used in the header is to ensure that as a header verifier you do not need to download all txs, you can just take previous header and then calculate the excess data gas)
